rubydanger: My “scene”, or whatever you wanna call it, was presented with multiple victims speaking up and photographic and witness statement evidence and a few of us (the survivors) knew each other so we had cross checked all of our stories and put together timelines and the community (I use that term very loosely) still says they don’t believe the things he did. The cognitive dissonance is ASTOUNDING and offensive af. I became very good friends with his ex, and we are healing together. We don’t go out as much as we used to for fear of running into him. I don’t hardly go out at all and I’ve thought about relocating because of the tension and hyper vigilance anytime I go anywhere he might be. It sucks to be the one made to feel like shit by people who “just don’t see how he could do that” while he’s just living his life with no worries or accountability. My heart is with everyone that’s ever been made to feel that way, especially by people you thought cared about you. You’re all very strong and brave and should be proud of yourselves.
